question: Which day is observed on February 10 and August 10 every year in India?
explanation:
In India, every year February 10 and August 10 are observed as the National Deworming Day (NDD).
The day aims to eradicate intestinal worms within the age bracket of 1-19 years, which are also referred to as Soil-Transmitted Helminths (STH). As per the World Health Organisation, about 241 million children in India between 1-14 years are at risk of parasitic intestinal worms.
